intro: Conyza bifoliolata, commonly known as the two-leafed weed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is an annual herb that thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural areas. Conyza bifoliolata is known for its ability to spread rapidly and is considered a weed in many regions.
